data.title: Rasheed Wallace attributes Draymond Green's behavior to the 2004 Pistons team: That's our fault
data.meta_description: According to Rasheed Wallace, Green's outbursts stem from what he saw in the locker room of Detroit‚Äôs 2004 NBA championship team featuring himself, Chauncey Billups, Rip Hamilton, Ben Wallace and Tayshaun Prince. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs our fault...
data.text:
By HoopsHype |

According to Rasheed Wallace, Green‚Äôs outbursts stem from what he saw in the locker room of Detroit‚Äôs 2004 NBA championship team featuring himself, Chauncey Billups, Rip Hamilton, Ben Wallace and Tayshaun Prince. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs our fault‚Ä¶ [Draymond Green] grew up in [the 2004 Pistons] locker room,‚Äù Wallace said on the show. ‚ÄúOne of his best friends was the son of the GM, so he was around us‚Ä¶ Practice, in the locker room, after games, before games, he heard the different language, and we all know it‚Äôs a different language when the cameras are not there. ‚Ä¶ That‚Äôs why he doing the bully s‚Äî he doing now, in my opinion. He caught all that s‚Äî in our locker room.‚Äù

Source: Sports Illustrated

What‚Äôs the buzz on Twitter?

Ball Don‚Äôt Lie @Balldontlie

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs our fault ‚Ä¶ [Draymond] grew up in our locker room ‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs why he doing the bully s*** he doing now.‚Äù

Rasheed Wallace on how the 2004 Pistons influenced Draymond Green.

(via @GilsArenaShow)

pic.twitter.com/0jyoPGAwWy ‚Äì 2:31 PM

Draymond Green @Money23Green

The FSU debate is unfortunate yet funny. The committee got it right. The only thing they should‚Äôve been debating is how to get Bama and Georgia in. However, the other 3 teams were deserving. As was FSU but they‚Äôre playing with their 3rd string QB. ü§∑üèø‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Now go ahead and expand it!! ‚Äì 12:31 PM

Gilbert Arenas @GilsArenaShow

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs our fault‚Ä¶ cause [Draymond] grew up in our locker room‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs why he doing the bully sh*t he doing now.‚Äù

Sheed on how the 2004 Pistons influenced Draymond Green pic.twitter.com/y9B5gksMGt ‚Äì 12:00 PM

Probably the coolest bobble head I‚Äôve seen to date! The Warriors will be giving the first 10k fans in attendance on Wednesday night this Draymond Broadcast Bobblehead. The Dubs host the the Blazers. pic.twitter.com/UYGEZle1cq ‚Äì 11:03 PM

Kristian Winfield @Krisplashed

Draymond Green would have gotten suspended 10 games for what Trey Lyles just got a technical foul for. ‚Äì 11:01 PM

T Lue on Draymond 3s early and final possession late pic.twitter.com/oazV6L9gSc ‚Äì 7:01 PM

Having Draymond in corner worked against them. Russ sagged to cut off Curry‚Äôs drive

DG should‚Äôve screened for Steph. Esp on an off night, you want Kawhi off him. Stepback is off the table vs KL‚Äôs length. (One vs Mann was halfway down)

Our put Klay/Moses in corner to deter help ‚Äì 6:59 PM

Ohm Youngmisuk @NotoriousOHM

Clippers pull off their biggest win of the season, a comeback from down 22 to beat the Warriors. Steph drove and passed to Draymond, who missed what would have been the game-winning 3. Huge win for the Clippers, who now have a few days off before hosting the defending champs. ‚Äì 6:33 PM

And one tackle. statmuse.com/nba/player/dra‚Ä¶ ‚Äì 6:33 PM

His 21 points are his most in a regular season game since the 2017-18 season ‚Äì 6:14 PM

March 17, 2018 ‚Äì 4:49 PM

He did it within the first 8 minutes of the game today in LA ‚Äì 4:31 PM

Draymond Green has 4 3s ‚Äì in the first quarter

Draymond hits his fourth 3 of the game and Klay got hit with a tech for stepping onto the court while celebrating from the bench. This is the second time in three Clippers games a player got hit with a tech for celebrating on bench. Bones got a tech in Sac on Wednesday. ‚Äì 4:28 PM

Anthony Slater @anthonyVslater

That‚Äôs now four first quarter 3s from Draymond Green. He started yelling at the Clippers bench after the fourth. Warriors bench was so fired up Klay Thompson was hit for a technical for coming on the floor in celebration. ‚Äì 4:27 PM

This is basically a Warriors home game, I bet Chris Paul is happy to be on the other side of these things üòÇ

Anyways

Draymond Green has 3 3s, Warriors lead 18-13. Zu is doing his part offensively, making all 3 of his attempts. 5:16 left in 1st ‚Äì 4:24 PM

That‚Äôs already three first quarter 3s from Draymond Green. He‚Äôs now 50 percent for the season: 16-of-32. Seven games with 2+ makes. Only had six games of multiple makes all last season. ‚Äì 4:22 PM

Are the Clippers really going to keep leaving Draymond wide-open from 3?? ‚Äì 4:22 PM

Energy burst from the Warriors to open this afternoon game in Los Angeles. Draymond Green has already blocked a 3 and made a 3. He‚Äôs 14-of-29 from deep this season. Hustle putback from Moses Moody while falling to the ground. Quick 9-2 lead over Clippers. ‚Äì 4:15 PM

More on this storyline

The four-time NBA champion holds the second most ejections (19) in NBA history, with Wallace (29) the only player ahead of him. Asked if he thought Green would eclipse his mark, the 49-year-old gave a candid statement of the possibility. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs f‚Äî‚Äìg gooooo,‚Äù Wallace said. -via Sports Illustrated / December 5, 2023

Clutch Points: Rasheed Wallace says he thinks Kevin Durant is still the best player in the NBA üëÄ ‚ÄúI still think right now he‚Äôs the best player in the league. No disrespect to everybody else. It just comes too simple for him, dog.‚Äù (via @GilsArenaShow) pic.twitter.com/ghnyAzHXjP -via Twitter @ClutchPointsApp / December 5, 2023

‚ÄúI played this game because my dad played. I idolized him. My favorite athletes were hoopers. Kobe (Bryant). Clyde Drexler and Rasheed Wallace, guys I was able to watch growing up. Reggie Miller. I just wanted to do something I loved for a living. It happened to be basketball. The fact I‚Äôm doing it for a 13th straight season is amazing. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt need to go into this year and ‚Ä¶ I know if I just do my job and I‚Äôm in shape and I compete at my highest level, I‚Äôm going to make money in this league for a long time. So I don‚Äôt worry about it. I‚Äôm blessed beyond measure. Obviously you want to make the most in the window you have as an athlete. But I‚Äôm not going to let that get in the way of winning a championship. When you win, everything else will be taken care of.‚Äù -via The Athletic / October 11, 2023
